intro: Taraxacum scotodes, commonly known as the Scottish dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of spoon-shaped, hairy leaves and a yellow composite flower head that develops into a puffball of seeds. Native to northern Europe, it thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in grasslands and woodland edges. The plant has a taproot system and is known for its ability to spread via wind-dispersed seeds. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
